featured.text: This energy allowed the water 24 into the air, which looked just like sneezing!
They found that the sick plants could “sneeze” and 23 tiny water drops filled with leaf rust germs, spreading the disease to neighboring plants.
However, not all plants can sneeze.
Plant diseases can also spread through tiny water drops that jump off leaves— a plant’s version of a sneeze.

definition.zh_def: 打噴嚏；因刺激而引起的突然呼吸道排氣。
definition.en_def: To expel air from the nose and mouth suddenly and involuntarily, often as a reflex to irritation in the nasal passages.
definition.example: She couldn't stop herself from sneezing when the pollen count was high.
